DataElement.preferredName: Loss of Heterozygosity Finding Identifier java.lang.Long
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A genetic abnormality that is characterized by the partial loss of specific gene function via the deletion or mutation of one allele of a heterozygous gene locus. When this occurs at a tumor suppressor gene locus in a phenotype that already contains an abnormal allele, loss of heterozygosity can contribute to neoplastic transformation.:The result of an examination or inquiry._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A genetic abnormality that is characterized by the partial loss of specific gene function via the deletion or mutation of one allele of a heterozygous gene locus. When this occurs at a tumor suppressor gene locus in a phenotype that already contains an abnormal allele, loss of heterozygosity can contribute to neoplastic transformation.:The result of an examination or inquiry._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A genetic abnormality that is characterized by the partial loss of specific gene function via the deletion or mutation of one allele of a heterozygous gene locus. When this occurs at a tumor suppressor gene locus in a phenotype that already contains an abnormal allele, loss of heterozygosity can contribute to neoplastic transformation.:The result of an examination or inquiry.

Concepts.definition: A genetic variation where gain, loss, or exchange of DNA results in monoallelic loss of function mutations in a diploid cell. In the context of tumor suppressor genes, where a single copy is sufficient for functionality, loss of function for the second allele is associated with tumorigenesis.
The result of an examination or inquiry.

Property.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
